business.headline: Meesho IPO listing today: At what price will the shares open? Check GMPMeesho IPO was subscribed 81.76 times overall. Retail investors subscribed 19.89 times, qualified institutional buyers excluding anchor investors subscribed 123.34 times, while the non-institutional investor portion was booked 39.85 times.

Satya Nadella's big announcement for India: Rs 1.5 lakh crore for AI first futureMicrosoft CEO Satya Nadella announced that he is committing USD 17.5 billion, the company's largest-ever investment in Asia, to build infrastructure and skills needed for boosting Artificial Intelligence (AI) in India.

Are ULIPS really giving 14% returns, or is it just smart mis-selling?Can ULIPs genuinely deliver 14% returns, or are these projections built on selective calculations and hidden costs? How accurate are these projections? Expert explains.

Mehli Mistry steps down from NCPA board, Tata Trusts' Vijay Singh replaces him: ReportMehli Mistry was on the NCPA council as a nominee of the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and served alongside other Trusts' representatives, including Jehangir H. Jehangir and Pramit Jhaveri.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as investors cautious ahead of US Fed policy decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 436.41 points to close at 84,666.28, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 120.90 points to end at 25,839.65.

Still waiting for your tax refund? 5 common ITR errors and how to correct themIf your tax refund is taking longer than usual, you're not the only one. In most cases, the delay isn't due to the system but small filing mistakes that can easily be fixed.

Anil Ambani's son Jai Anmol named in Rs 228 crore banking fraud case by CBIThe complaint alleges cheating, criminal conspiracy and criminal misconduct that led to a wrongful loss of Rs 228.06 crore to the bank involved.

Wakefit vs Corona: Which IPO offers the best value? Check detailsIn terms of demand, Corona Remedies is witnessing stronger interest from investors. As of December 9, 2025, the Corona Remedies IPO is subscribed 1.78 times overall

Kaynes Technology shares jump over 9% today: Why is the stock rising?The rebound comes amid bargain hunting and selective buying after the recent correction was triggered by a critical report from Kotak, which flagged gaps in disclosures and raised concerns around the company's working capital position.

Rupee weakness, liquidity stress: Why Sensex and Nifty are under pressureIn the past few sessions, benchmark indices have stayed under pressure. Is the falling rupee to blame, or is foreign selling creating a liquidity squeeze? Here's why Dalal Street is on edge.

Can gold maintain its upward momentum despite today's decline?Gold and silver prices remain cautious as investors await the US Federal Reserve's interest rate decision, with experts highlighting recent market trends and key support levels.

Proposed insurance ombudsman rules: What policyholders should knowThe Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) recently released the Draft Internal Insurance Ombudsman Guidelines, 2025. These rules propose a new accountability structure inside insurance companies to speed up dispute resolution and reduce harassment of consumers.

Are new ITR forms coming before FY28? Here's what the government saysThe Indian government is preparing to implement a new Income Tax Act from April 1, 2026. This article examines the upcoming changes to tax forms, the timeline for notification, and the government's efforts to simplify compliance for taxpayers.

Sensex falls over 700 points: Why is the stock market down today?The Sensex has slipped over 700 points to fall below 84,400, while the Nifty has tumbled below 25,800, led by losses in banking, metal, and IT stocks.
Sensex opens 350 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; Kotak Bank down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 400.82 points to 84,701.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 134.80 points to 25,825.75 as of 9:24 am.
Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market fall again?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,964.5 around 8:03 am, hinting that the Nifty 50 might open close to Monday's closing level of 25,960.55.

Meesho, Aequs IPO debut: Can these listings make you rich? GMP gives a hintMeesho and Aequs shares are set for their stock market debut on December 10. Both IPOs attracted robust investor attention during the bidding phase.

Trump greenlights Nvidia H200 AI chip sales to China as US gets 25% cutDonlad Trump said that he had informed President Xi Jinping of China, where Nvidia's chips are under government scrutiny, about the move and he "responded positively," according to Trump's post.

Trump considers fresh tariffs on Indian rice as US farmers allege unfair dumpingThis comes after US farmers urged tougher action, arguing that subsidised rice imports are battering US markets and pushing domestic prices down. Donald Trump vowed to "take care" of the issue and pressed officials to identify countries accused of undercutting US markets.
Monopolies, duopolies and oligopolies: IndiGo's unique grip on global marketNo airline in any major market of the world dominates its home skies like IndiGo does.

entertainment.headline: Watch: SRK recites iconic Om Shanti Om dialogue, makes grand entry at Dubai expo Shah Rukh Khan captivated over 6,000 fans at Dubai Expo City with reflections on hard work, gratitude, and personal philosophy. Several videos from the event have gone viral.

Nagarjuna congratulates Mohanlal on his Dadasaheb Phalke Award: Most deserving Nagarjuna congratulated Mohanlal on receiving the prestigious Dadasaheb Phalke Award at a Chennai event. The moment underscored Mohanlal's standing as one of Indian cinema's most deserving actors.

Priyanka Chopra talks about being greedy for work in her 20s, and early hustle Priyanka Chopra reflected on her early-career hustle, sharing she once said yes to every opportunity and made major sacrifices to build the life she has today. Now able to be selective, she credits her younger self's discipline and relentless work ethic for her global success.

Pocso-accused Jani Master's wife becomes dance association president. Watch Ayesha, known professionally as Sumalatha, was elected President of the Telugu Film and TV Dancers and Dance Directors Association. Her election comes as her husband, choreographer Jani Master, faces ongoing legal controversy related to a Pocso case.

Dhurandhar box office Day 5: Ranveer Singh's film crosses Rs 150 crore mark Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar has turned into a box office juggernaut, crossing Rs 150 crore within five days and maintaining strong weekday momentum.

Dhurandhar's hidden weapon? TV stars whose casting adds an edge to the action drama From living-room favourites to big screen scene-stealers, several TV stars make an impact in Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar, proving that small screen's big names can be vital assets in a film's cast.

Akhanda 2 ready to roar: Balakrishna's film locks new release date after legal row The much-anticipated Balakrishna-starrer Akhanda 2: Thaandavam will release globally on December 12, with paid premieres scheduled for December 11. The makers announced the film's release date on December 9.

It was real: Pamela Anderson breaks silence on her romance with Liam Neeson Pamela Anderson has opened up for the first time about her brief romance with Liam Neeson, sharing heartfelt memories of their intimate week together and the bond they built off-camera.

One beautiful moment: Miley Cyrus celebrates Golden Globe nod with gratitude Miley Cyrus earned her third Golden Globe nomination for Best Original Song with "Dream as One" from Avatar: Fire and Ash, celebrating the honor with a heartfelt message of gratitude and transformation.

The Drama first look: Zendaya and Robert Pattinson sends fans into a frenzy Zendaya unveiled the first-look poster of her 2026 romantic comedy The Drama, co-starring Robert Pattinson, sparking massive excitement online.

New parents Katrina-Vicky are blissful, sleep deprived in 4th anniversary selfie Marking their fourth anniversary, Vicky Kaushal shared a selfie with Katrina Kaif, admitting the couple is "sleep-deprived" after welcoming their baby boy in November. The actor lovingly gazed at Katrina in the sweet post, showing their blissful new chapter as parents.

JioHotstar unveils Vijay Sethupathi's Kaatan, Kajal Aggarwal's Vishakha and more JioHotstar has pledged a significant Rs 4,000 crore investment over five years to boost South India's creative economy. Highlighted by a new partnership with the Government of Tamil Nadu and initiatives aimed at nurturing regional talent.

Smriti Irani gives shout-out to Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar with powerful quote Actor Smriti Irani praised Aditya Dhar's spy-thriller 'Dhurandhar' on social media with a quote, while tagging the film. She highlighted themes of peace and violence.
Not in race for rugby presidency from Himachal, clarifies Rahul Bose Actor Rahul Bose said he won't seek the Rugby India presidency from Himachal Pradesh.

Radhika Pandit lists all roles Yash plays in her life in sweet anniversary post Actors Yash and Radhika Pandit celebrate their wedding anniversary on December 9. To mark the occasion this year, Radhika posted an adorable video reflecting on their relationship.

Unassuming and ego less! Ameesha Patel praises Humraaz co-star Akshaye Khanna Ameesha Patel shared a nostalgic picture from the promotions of 'Humraaz', praising former co-actor Akshaye Khanna's "ego less" persona. She also acknowledged his recent success with Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar'.

Kartik Aaryan reveals why he wanted to be typecast in his early Bollywood years Kartik Aaryan shared honest reflections on his early struggles, his decision to embrace typecasting, and the choices that shaped his career. He now prepares for the release of Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri.

BB19 winner Gaurav Khanna reacts to backlash over his wife's no-kids choice 'Bigg Boss 19' winner Gaurav Khanna has openly supported his wife's decision on motherhood. In an exclusive interview, he also talked about being christened the 'greenest flag'.

Zubeen Garg tribute by Post Malone wows Guwahati crowd. Watch Post Malone paid tribute to the late Assamese music icon Zubeen Garg during his performance in Guwahati. This evoked an emotional reaction from thousands gathered at the concert venue.

general news.headline: Goa nightclub co-owner Ajay Gupta detained four days after fire killed 25Since the blaze on December 7, the police have arrested the nightclub's chief general manager Rajiv Modak, general manager Vivek Singh, bar manager Rajiv Singhania, gate manager Riyanshu Thakur and employee Bharat Kohli.

New US visa rule sparks panic among Indians as social media checks beginA new US rule requiring H-1B and H-4 applicants to make social media public has sparked anxiety among Indians, as consulates cancel visa appointments and delays threaten jobs, travel and family plans.

Centre trims IndiGo operations by 10% to tackle nationwide disruptionsFollowing the order, IndiGo said it will continue to serve all its destinations while complying with the 10% curtailment of operations mandated by the Civil Aviation Ministry.

Anti-army stand? Imran Khan could face treason case, signals Pak govtPakistan's government of PM Shehbaz Sharif has warned jailed former PM Imran Khan that treason cases against him could not be ruled out. Sharif's advisor, Rana Sanaullah, cautioned Khan and PTI leaders to not take the warning lightly, adding doing so could lead to "serious consequences".

T20 World Cup: It's still not too late to abort Shubman Gill experimentIND vs SA: India begun their T20 World Cup preparation with a massive 101-run win against South Africa. As India get closer to the world tournament, they really need to ask themselves this - does Shubman Gill deserve a spot in the T20I side?

Luthra brothers flee to Thailand after Goa club fire. Can they be extradited?On December 7, just hours after the deadly blaze broke out at their Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub in Goa's Arpora beach claimed 25 lives, owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra fled to Phuket, Thailand from Delhi aboard an IndiGo flight.

Pak army spokesperson winks at woman journalist, video sparks outragePakistan's Lt Gen Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry is facing backlash after winking at a woman journalist during a press briefing. His gesture has drawn criticism online.

Jasprit Bumrah becomes first India bowler with 100 wickets in all formatsJasprit Bumrah made history in Cuttack by becoming the first Indian bowler to reach 100 wickets in Tests, ODIs and T20Is. He brought up his 100th T20I wicket in the opening match of the series against South Africa.
A Hyderabad architect opened the Chanel show in New York. Her storyBhavitha Mandava hails from Hyderabad and moved to New York City to pursue a master's degree at New York University.

Pak played it right, India faced tariffs for countering Trump: Raghuram RajanRaghuram Rajan, former RBI Governor, said the US's imposition of a 50% tariff on India had less to do with the purchase of Russian oil and more to do with Delhi's contradicting US President Trump's claim of brokering peace in the May war. He said "Pakistan played well", and escaped with just 16% tariffs.

US revokes 85,000 visas amid sweeping immigration and security crackdownThe State Department says visa cancellations have surged as officials expand continuous vetting, tighten national-security reviews and target criminal offenses under the Trump administration's latest immigration enforcement push.

Keep Your Little Ones Cozy This Winter with Amazon Everyday EssentialsWhether you're looking to care for little ones or find the perfect gift, this collection of baby and kids' essentials brings together nourishment, comfort, and thoughtful design.

Bangladesh moves away from India, makes Brazil its top cotton sourceBrazil has overtaken India as the largest raw cotton supplier to Bangladesh, whose economy depends on the readymade garments sector. The shift coincides with the fall of the Sheikh Hasina regime in Bangladesh. However, India remains the top cotton yarn supplier to Bangladesh.

Out or not out? No-ball controversy over Jasprit Bumrah's 100th T20I wicketIND vs SA: Jasprit Bumrah's 100th T20I wicket, the controversial dismissal of Dewald Brevis, became a major talking point in India's dominant 101-run win over South Africa in the first T20I at Cuttack.

Divorces force Chola-era Bengaluru temple to stop weddingsThe 12th-century Someshwara Temple in Bengaluru has stopped hosting marriages after priests were spending more time in court than in rituals. Rising divorce cases and fake documents from eloping couples prompted the Ulsoor temple, built in the Chola period, to halt ceremonies to protect its image and avoid legal hassles.

Morning or evening? Science reveals the best time to drink green teaMany people drink green tea every day, but the best time to drink it is still debated. Science now offers a clear answer to when green tea gives the most benefits.

Satya Nadella's big announcement for India: Rs 1.5 lakh crore for AI first futureMicrosoft CEO Satya Nadella announced that he is committing USD 17.5 billion, the company's largest-ever investment in Asia, to build infrastructure and skills needed for boosting Artificial Intelligence (AI) in India.

Singapore's name comes from Sanskrit, Teo Chee Hean says as he hails India tiesTeo Chee Hean said Singapore's name comes from Sanskrit, underscoring India's early influence as he praised deepening India-Singapore ties, the role of the Indian diaspora and India's economic reforms.

Dhurandhar proves India can handle the truth without burning a busThe masses, which were always handled by the kid gloves of the intellectual elite, quarantined from the harsh past lest they revolt, have suddenly started accessing history beyond their textbooks.
Obesity, depression: What happens to children below 12 who own a smartphoneOwning a smartphone before the age of 12 has been linked with obesity, poor sleep and depression in children.

Man inserts rod in 6-year-old girl's private parts after failed rape attemptRajkot Police formed multiple teams, questioned around 100 suspects and presented 10 before the child. She identified 35-year-old farmworker Ramsingh Terasingh Dadwejar as the attacker.

Akhanda 2 ready to roar: Balakrishna's film locks new release date after legal rowThe much-anticipated Balakrishna-starrer Akhanda 2: Thaandavam will release globally on December 12, with paid premieres scheduled for December 11. The makers announced the film's release date on December 9.

They aren't doing desk work: Supreme Court raps poll body over threats to BLOsThe Supreme Court took serious note of allegations that BLOs and other field officials were facing threats, intimidation and obstruction while carrying out door-to-door verification. The bench also directed the poll panel to place on record specific instances of non-cooperation or obstruction by state authorities, assuring that the Court would issue appropriate directions.

Tamil cinema in crisis? Theatres witness dry December despite festival seasonTamil cinema seems to be facing an unprecedented box office crisis this December despite the festival season. Industry insiders warn that financial troubles and postponements could deepen the crisis in 2026.

Watch: SRK recites iconic Om Shanti Om dialogue, makes grand entry at Dubai expoShah Rukh Khan captivated over 6,000 fans at Dubai Expo City with reflections on hard work, gratitude, and personal philosophy. Several videos from the event have gone viral.

sports.headline: Salah-less Liverpool edge Inter as Chelsea suffer shock defeat to Atalanta Liverpool and Barcelona strengthened their Champions League push on a night of high drama, while Chelsea slipped further into trouble. Big wins, late twists and rising pressure reshaped the race for the top eight.

Is constant batting order shuffling hurting Suryakumar Yadav in T20Is? IND vs SA, 1st T20I: Suryakumar Yadav failed to perform in the opening T20I at the Barabati Stadium in Cuttack. He scored 12 off 11 before Lungi Ngidi accounted for his wicket.

Ashes 2025: Pat Cummins returns as Australia name 15-man squad for Adelaide Test Ashes 2025: Australia strengthened their Ashes campaign with Pat Cummins returning for the Adelaide Test. The captain's comeback arrived at a crucial moment as the hosts pushed to seal the series with two matches still remaining.

Arshdeep's reel game: What Bumrah must do to get the Kohli treatment Arshdeep Singh joked about how Jasprit Bumrah could feature in his Instagram reel like Virat Kohli. Arshdeep and Bumrah picked up two wickets each as India thrashed South Africa by 101 runs.

T20 World Cup: It's still not too late to abort Shubman Gill experiment IND vs SA: India begun their T20 World Cup preparation with a massive 101-run win against South Africa. As India get closer to the world tournament, they really need to ask themselves this - does Shubman Gill deserve a spot in the T20I side?

Samson is like an elder brother: Jitesh Sharma on T20 World Cup keeper rivalry IND vs SA, 1st T20I: Jitesh Sharma opened up about his relationship with Sanju Samson, describing it as one of brothers and saying the Kerala player generously shares his experience and helps him grow as a cricketer.

No fuss, only fire: Hardik's India-first mindset powers dream Cuttack return Hardik Pandya said that he has always kept India and the team first after making his dream return in Cuttack during the first T20I against South Africa. Hardik scored a fifty to save India and help them post a big total.

'Senior' Arshdeep welcomes 'junior' Bumrah to 100-wicket club in T20Is IND vs SA: Jasprit Bumrah completed the milestone of 100 T20I wickets during the first match of the series against South Africa. India seamer Arshdeep Singh welcomed him into the elite list with a big smile and a cheeky comment.

South Africa 74 all out: SA collapse to lowest T20I total after India run riot South Africa were bundled out for 74 during the first T20I against India in Cuttack on Tuesday, handing the hosts a commanding 101-run victory. The total was South Africa's lowest in T20I cricket.

Out or not out? No-ball controversy over Jasprit Bumrah's 100th T20I wicket IND vs SA: Jasprit Bumrah's 100th T20I wicket, the controversial dismissal of Dewald Brevis, became a major talking point in India's dominant 101-run win over South Africa in the first T20I at Cuttack.

Hardik blitz, ruthless bowlers help India crush South Africa, end Cuttack jinx Hardik Pandya's all-round blitz and a ruthless performance from the bowlers saw India crush South Africa by 101 runs in Cuttack on Tuesday, December 9.

Jasprit Bumrah becomes first India bowler with 100 wickets in all formatsJasprit Bumrah made history in Cuttack by becoming the first Indian bowler to reach 100 wickets in Tests, ODIs and T20Is. He brought up his 100th T20I wicket in the opening match of the series against South Africa.

From partners to rivals: Sania, Bopanna face off in TPL exhibition tieSania Mirza and Rohan Bopanna returned to the court for a special mixed-doubles exhibition, marking Mirza's first match in Ahmedabad in some time. Their reunion highlighted TPL's opening, drawing attention to the league's role in nurturing young tennis talent in India.

Hardik 'clutch' Pandya is true MVP: India all-rounder's 59 vs SA stuns fansIND vs SA, 2nd T20I: Fans praised Hardik Pandya's power-hitting 59-run knock in Cuttack, saying the all-rounder is India's true MVP in T20I cricket as he delivers with both bat and ball whenever the team needs him. Hardik smashed a sparkling unbeaten 28-ball 59 to lift India to 175 for six against South Africa.

Learn from Paris heroes: Sreejesh's message India before 3rd place tiePR Sreejesh asked his team to draw inspiration from India's Paris Olympics heroes ahead of their third-place tie against Argentina in the Jr.men's Hockey World Cup on Wednesday, December 10.

From U19 heroes to India call-ups: G Kamalini, Vaishnavi Sharma make big career jumpIndia rewarded G Kamalini and Vaishnavi Sharma with maiden call-ups as they named the 15-member squad for the T20I series against Sri Lanka to be held later this month. Both players played crucial roles in India's U19 Women's T20 World Cup campaign.

Ashes will get embarrassing if England can't win Adelaide Test: Glenn McGrathFormer Australian pacer Glenn McGrath believes England must win the third Test in Adelaide to avoid an embarrassing Ashes defeat, with Australia holding a commanding 2-0 series lead.

Cook Maggi while Gill bats: Fans slam batter after Cuttack T20I failureFans slammed Shubman Gill after the Indian vice-captain failed with the bat during the Cuttack T20I against South Africa. Gill faced just two balls and scored four runs.

Shubman Gill reveals details of neck injury that sidelined him for a monthIND vs SA, 1st T20I: Shubman Gill has detailed the neck injury that sidelined him for a month, explaining his hospitalisation, rehabilitation at the CoE, and preparation for India's T20I series against South Africa.

Smriti Mandhana resumes national duties, named in India squad for Sri Lanka T20IsSmriti Mandhana has been named in India's squad for the five-match T20I series against Sri Lanka. The left-hander, who was India's key performer in the Women's World Cup, recently called off her wedding with Palash Muchhal.

Lionel Messi to ramp walk in Mumbai, set to auction World Cup memorabiliaLegendary footballer Lionel Messi is visiting India on a 3-day trip. Messi is expected to ramp walk in a Mumbai fashion show and auction one of his FIFA World Cup 2022 memorabilia.

From opener to dropped: Sanju Samson snubbed for Jitesh Sharma in Cuttack T20IAfter excelling as an opener for the Indian team in T20Is, Sanju Samson finds himself dropped for the first match of the series against South Africa in Cuttack on Tuesday, December 9.

MS Dhoni plays pickleball in Dubai, looks fitter than ever before IPL 2026Dhoni was spotted enjoying a relaxed game of pickleball in Dubai ahead of the IPL 2026 auction, showcasing his fitness and high spirits at 44. Dhoni is set for his 19th IPL season and his 17th for CSK.

John Cena reveals shocking truth about WWE exit: Would have done this foreverJohn Cena has dropped a bombshell, saying that his retirement from WWE is not on his own terms. Cena ends his career at the Saturday Night's Main Event on December 13.

Australia-based Nikhil Chaudhary listed as uncapped Indian for auctionAustralia-based all-rounder Nikhil Chaudhary has sparked curiosity ahead of the IPL 2026 auction, having been listed as an uncapped Indian despite playing his professional cricket in Australia.

All alone: Mohamed Salah posts picture of training in empty gym after UCL snubMohamed Salah cut a lone figure at Liverpool's Melwood training ground as he was left out of the squad for the UEFA Champions League clash against Inter Milan on Tuesday, December 9.

Ben Stokes must start the tough conversation after Ashes setback: Nasser HussainNasser Hussain believes England's Ashes revival depends on Ben Stokes delivering hard truths. The former captain says supportive leadership must now give way to tough conversations after back-to-back defeats in Australia.

1st T20I Highlights: SA (74-all-out), India blow away Proteas by 101 runsIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA), 1st T20I Highlights: India smashed South Africa in the opening T20I of the series. Chasing 176, South Africa imploded against a disciplined bowling performance from the host. Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, Axar Patel, Hardik Pandya, Shivam Dube and Varun Chakravarthy were all among wickets as India wreaked havoc on the visitors.

His body keeps letting him down: Wood's Ashes exit soul-destroying, says HussainNasser Hussain has claimed that Mark Wood's body keeps on letting him down as the pacer was ruled out of the Ashes 2025-26 series after another injury setback on Tuesday, December 9.

How's Sunny Leone connected to cricket? R Ashwin's cryptic tweet explainedR Ashwin's cryptic post featuring Sunny Leone and a street photo was actually a playful hint toward young cricketer Sunny Sandhu. The clever wordplay helped spotlight Sandhu's recent heroics in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
